content:
TITLE: Installing Oruga UI Package
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing Oruga UI using different package managers or CDN.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @oruga-ui/oruga-next
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn add @oruga-ui/oruga-next
```

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<script src="https://unpkg.com/@oruga-ui/oruga-next/dist/oruga.js"></script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Vue App with Oruga Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to initialize a Vue application with Oruga plugin and pass configuration options. This snippet demonstrates how to customize the Autocomplete component's classes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/customisation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { createApp } from 'vue';
import Oruga from '@oruga-ui/oruga-next';

createApp(...)
    .use(Oruga, {
        autocomplete: {
            rootClass: 'autocomplete-root',
            itemClass: 'autocomplete-item',
            ...
        }
        ...
    });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Overriding Default Classes in Global Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to completely override existing default Oruga classes for a component by setting the override flag to true. This removes default classes and applies only the specified ones.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/customisation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
createApp(...)
    .use(Oruga, {
        autocomplete: {
            override: true,
            rootClass: 'autocomplete-root',
            itemClass: 'autocomplete-item',
            ...
        }
    });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining TypeScript Configuration Object for Oruga Components
DESCRIPTION: Example of defining a TypeScript configuration object for Oruga components with customized classes. This shows how to specify icon packs and override button styling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/customisation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import type { OrugaOptions } from "@oruga-ui/oruga-next";

const config: OrugaOptions = {
    iconPack: "fas",
    button: {
        override: true,
        rootClass: 'btn',
        roundedClass: 'btn-rounded',
        ...
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Autocomplete Component HTML Implementation
DESCRIPTION: A simple implementation example of the Autocomplete component. The component provides suggestions while the user types and implements the W3C ARIA APG Combobox Pattern.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Autocomplete.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<o-autocomplete></o-autocomplete>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Oruga UI for Vue.js 3
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Oruga UI library for Vue.js 3 projects using npm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @oruga-ui/oruga-next
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Full Bundle Import in Vue.js
DESCRIPTION: Example of importing and using the complete Oruga UI library in a Vue.js application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { createApp } from 'vue';
import Oruga from '@oruga-ui/oruga-next';

createApp(...).use(Oruga);
```

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<template>
  <o-button>oruga-ui</o-button>
</template>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Dropdown Implementation in Oruga UI
DESCRIPTION: Basic implementation of the Oruga UI Dropdown component. The component can be used as either a quick menu or as a customizable select element for displaying discoverable content options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Dropdown.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<o-dropdown></o-dropdown>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Arrays and Functions for Component Class Customization
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates advanced class customization techniques using arrays and functions. Shows how to specify multiple classes and use dynamic suffix-based class generation for dropdown positioning.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/customisation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
createApp(...)
    .use(Oruga, {
        dropdown: {
            rootClass: ['dropdown-root', 'additional-class'],
            positionClass: {
                class: (suffix) => `dropdown-menu-${suffix}`,
            },
            itemClass: 'dropdown-item',
        }
        ...
    });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Tree-Shaking Oruga Components with Manual Registration
DESCRIPTION: Code example for tree-shaking by manually registering only specific Oruga components in a Vue 3 application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { createApp } from 'vue'
import { OField, OInput } from '@oruga-ui/oruga'

createApp(...)
  .use(OField)
  .use(OInput)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Basic Table Component in Oruga UI (HTML)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the basic usage of the Oruga UI Table component. It uses HTML's native table element to display tabular data in a responsive manner.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Table.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<o-table></o-table>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Applying Conditional Styling Based on Component Props
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to customize component styling based on component props. This example applies Bootstrap-style variants to buttons only when they're not outlined.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/customisation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
createApp(...)
    .use(Oruga, {
        button: {
            rootClass: (_, props) => {
                if (props.iconRight) return 'has-icons-right';
            },
            variantClass: (variant, props) => {
                if (!props.outlined) return `btn-${variant}`;
            }
        },
        ...
    });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Pagination Component Usage
DESCRIPTION: The basic implementation of the Pagination component in Oruga UI. This component creates a responsive pagination control that can be customized through various props.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Pagination.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<o-pagination></o-pagination>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing Oruga Theme SCSS
DESCRIPTION: Example of importing the Oruga theme's SCSS stylesheet
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/themes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import '@oruga-ui/theme-oruga/dist/scss/oruga.scss';
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Modifying Oruga Configuration Programmatically
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to access and modify Oruga's global configuration using the useOruga composable. This allows runtime customization of component styling and behavior.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/composables.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { useOruga, type OrugaOptions } from '@oruga-ui/oruga-next';

const oruga = useOruga();

// get the current config
const config = oruga.config.getOptions();

// modify the config object
const myThemeConfig: OrugaOptions = {
    ...config,
    autocomplete: {
        rootClass: 'autocomplete-root',
        itemClass: 'autocomplete-item',
        ...
    }
}

// update the config
oruga.config.setOptions(myThemeConfig);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Theme Configuration Setup
DESCRIPTION: JavaScript configuration for setting up Oruga with specific themes
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/themes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import '@oruga-ui/theme-oruga/dist/oruga.css'
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
createApp(...)
    .use(Oruga, {
        steps: {
            itemActiveClass: 'steps-nav-item-active',
            itemPreviousClass: 'steps-nav-item-previous',
            stepMarkerClass: 'step-marker',
            stepDividerClass: 'step-divider',
        }
    });
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { createApp } from 'vue'

import Oruga from '@oruga-ui/oruga-next';

import { bulmaConfig } from '@oruga-ui/theme-bulma';

import '@oruga-ui/theme-bulma/dist/bulma.css';

createApp(...)
    .use(Oruga, bulmaConfig)
    .mount('#app')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing the Basic Datepicker Component in HTML
DESCRIPTION: Basic implementation of the Oruga UI Datepicker component. This snippet shows the minimal markup required to add a datepicker input that displays a dropdown/modal calendar for date selection and uses native datepicker on mobile devices.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Datepicker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<o-datepicker></o-datepicker>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Tree Shaking Implementation
DESCRIPTION: Examples of importing individual Oruga components for optimized bundle size.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { createApp } from 'vue';
import { Autocomplete, Sidebar } from '@oruga-ui/oruga-next';

createApp(...)
  .use(Autocomplete)
  .use(Sidebar);
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { OrugaConfig } from '@oruga-ui/oruga-next';

const options: OrugaOptions = { ... }

createApp(...).use(OrugaConfig, options);
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { createApp } from 'vue';
import { OAutocomplete, OSidebar } from '@oruga-ui/oruga-next';

createApp(...)
  .component(OAutocomplete)
  .component(OSidebar);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Registering Oruga Plugin in Nuxt Config
DESCRIPTION: Configuration snippet showing how to register the Oruga plugin in nuxt.config.js file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
plugins: [{ src: '~plugins/oruga.js' }]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Registering All Oruga Components in Vue 3
DESCRIPTION: Code snippet to import and register all Oruga UI components globally in a Vue 3 application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { createApp } from 'vue'

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Integrating Oruga with Nuxt.js via Plugin
DESCRIPTION: Code for creating a Nuxt.js plugin to integrate Oruga UI into a Nuxt application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import Oruga from '@oruga-ui/oruga-next';

export default defineNuxtPlugin((nuxtApp) => {
  nuxtApp.vueApp.use(Oruga);
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: CSS Variable Customization
DESCRIPTION: Examples of customizing global and component-specific CSS variables
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/themes.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```

  --oruga-variant-primary: green;

```

TITLE: Basic Menu Component Usage in HTML

SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Menu.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

TITLE: Initializing Button Component in HTML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the basic usage of the Button component in HTML. The Button component is a versatile UI element that can be customized with various props and styles.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Button.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:

<o-button></o-button>
```

TITLE: Configuring Individual Component Class Properties in HTML
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add custom classes directly to a component using the specific class properties in the template. This example customizes the root and item classes of an Autocomplete component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/customisation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```

    root-class="autocomplete-root" 
    item-class="autocomplete-item" />

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Upload Component Usage in HTML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the basic usage of the Upload component in HTML. It demonstrates how to include the component in your markup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Upload.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Oruga Theme
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing and importing the default Oruga theme.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install @oruga-ui/theme-oruga
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
yarn add @oruga-ui/theme-oruga
```

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://unpkg.com/@oruga-ui/theme-oruga/dist/oruga.min.css" />
```

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Programmatic Component Interface with useOruga
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the programmatic interface for a component (Sidebar) through the useOruga composable. This allows creating component instances directly without template declarations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/composables.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { useOruga } from "@oruga-ui/oruga-next";

const oruga = useOruga();

const target = document.body;

oruga.sidebar.open({
    component: MyCoolComponent,
    fullheight: true,
    overlay: true,
}, target);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Modal Component in Oruga UI (HTML)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the basic usage of the Oruga UI Modal component. The Modal is a classic overlay that can include any desired content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Modal.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<o-modal></o-modal>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Checkbox Implementation in HTML
DESCRIPTION: Basic implementation of the Oruga UI Checkbox component. This component is a wrapper around the native HTML checkbox input that provides additional styling and functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Checkbox.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<o-checkbox></o-checkbox>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Component Programmatic for Custom Components
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to render any custom component programmatically using the ComponentProgrammatic interface provided by Oruga. This creates a separate Vue instance and mounts the component into a specified target.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/composables.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { useOruga } from "@oruga-ui/oruga-next";
import MyComponent from "...";

const oruga = useOruga();

const slot = "My default slot content";

oruga.programmatic.open(
    MyComponent,
    {
        target: document.body, // target container the programmatic component get rendered into
        appId: "programmatic-app", // HTML #id of the app div rendered into the target container 
        props: { ... }, // component specific props
        onClose: (...args: unknown[]) => { ... }, // on close event handler
    }
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Modal trapFocus Property in Oruga UI
DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring the trapFocus property for the Modal component through the Oruga config object. This setting traps focus inside the modal when enabled.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Modal.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
modal: {
  trapFocus: true
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring SCSS Variables for Oruga UI Bootstrap Theme
DESCRIPTION: This SCSS snippet defines key variables and maps for customizing the Bootstrap theme in Oruga UI. It includes settings for host variables, animation speeds, size variants, and color customizations. The code also mentions available theme color maps for further customization.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/themes/theme-bootstrap.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
// adds :root variables also as :host
$enable-host: true !default;

$speed-slow: 150ms !default;
$speed-slower: 250ms !default;
$easing: ease !default;

// sizes variants
$sizes: (
    "x-small": 0.5rem,
    "small": 0.75rem,
    "medium": 1.25rem,
    "large": 1.5rem,
    "x-large": 2rem,
) !default;

// adding aditional gray-light color to colors map
$custom-colors: (
    "gray-light": $gray-300,
);
$colors: map.merge($colors, $custom-colors);

// these theme color maps are available:
// - $theme-colors                -> var(--#{$prefix}#{$name});
// - $theme-colors-contrast       -> var(--#{$prefix}#{$name}-contrast);
// - $theme-colors-text           -> var(--#{$prefix}#{$name}-text-emphasis);
// - $theme-colors-rgb            -> var(--#{$prefix}#{$name}-rgb);
// - $theme-colors-bg-subtle      -> var(--#{$prefix}#{$name}-bg-subtle)
// - $theme-colors-border-subtle  -> var(--#{$prefix}#{$name}-border-subtle)
```

----------------------------------------

SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Select.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

TITLE: Defining SCSS Variables for Oruga UI Theme
DESCRIPTION: This SCSS snippet defines a wide range of variables used in the Oruga UI theme. It includes settings for prefix, animations, fonts, base styles, control elements, sizes, and a color palette. These variables can be customized to adjust the theme's appearance and behavior.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/themes/theme-oruga.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
// Settings
$prefix: "oruga-" !default;
$enable-host: true !default;

// Animations
$animation-speed: 150ms !default;
$animation-speed-fast: 300ms !default;
$animation-timing: ease-out !default;

// Font
$base-font-family: 
// Cross-platform generic font family (default user interface font)
    system-ui,
    // Safari for macOS and iOS (San Francisco)
    -apple-system,
    // Windows
    "Segoe UI",
    // Android
    Roboto,
    // older macOS and iOS
    "Helvetica Neue",
    // Linux
    "Noto Sans",
    "Liberation Sans",
    // Basic web fallback
    Arial,
    // Sans serif fallback
    sans-serif !default;
$base-font-size: 1rem !default;
$base-font-weight: 400 !default;
$base-line-height: 1.5 !default;

// Base Style
$base-border-radius: 4px !default;
$base-border-radius-rounded: 9999px !default;
$base-line-height: 1.5 !default;
$base-disabled-opacity: 0.5 !default;

$control-border-width: 1px !default;
$control-height: 2.25em !default;
$control-padding-vertical: calc(0.25em - #{$control-border-width});
$control-padding-horizontal: calc(1em - #{$control-border-width});
$control-box-shadow: inset 0 1px 2px hsla(0, 0%, 4%, 0.1);

// Sizes
$sizes: (
    "small": 0.75rem,
    "medium": 1.25rem,
    "large": 1.5rem,
) !default;

// Colors
$white: #ffffff !default;
$black: #000000 !default;
$grey: #7a7a7a !default;
$grey-light: #b5b5b5 !default;
$grey-lighter: #dbdbdb !default;
$grey-dark: #4a4a4a !default;

$primary: #445e00 !default;
$primary-invert: $white !default;
$secondary: #6c757d !default;
$secondary-invert: $white !default;

$success: #006724 !default;
$success-invert: $white !default;
$info: #005c98 !default;
$info-invert: $white !default;
$warning: #f4c300 !default;
$warning-invert: $black !default;
$danger: #b60000 !default;
$danger-invert: $white !default;

$colors: (
    "primary": (
        $primary,
        $primary-invert,
    ),
    "secondary": (
        $secondary,
        $secondary-invert,
    ),
    "success": (
        $success,
        $success-invert,
    ),
    "info": (
        $info,
        $info-invert,
    ),
    "warning": (
        $warning,
        $warning-invert,
    ),
    "danger": (
        $danger,
        $danger-invert,
    ),
) !default;
```

TITLE: Basic Notification Component Usage in HTML
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to use the basic Notification component in HTML. This creates a notification alert that can be customized with various props.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Notification.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

TITLE: Configuring teleport Property in DateTimePicker
DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to define where the component should be rendered in the DOM. When set to true, the component will be appended to the body, or it can accept a CSS selector or DOM node.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Datetimepicker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15

TITLE: Configuring Front Matter for Oruga Documentation Homepage
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for the Oruga documentation homepage, defining layout, metadata, hero section, and key features. Includes SEO meta tags, page structure, and core value propositions of the framework.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/index.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
---
layout: home
title: Oruga
description: Oruga is a lightweight UI components library for Vue.js without CSS framework dependency.
head:
  - - meta
    - name: Oruga is a lightweight library of UI components for Vue.js without CSS framework dependency.
  - - meta
    - name: keywords
      content: oruga vue vuejs components ux ui css agnostic framework
hero:
  name: Oruga
  image: 
    src: logo.png
  text: ''
  tagline: Oruga UI is like a caterpillar, minimal and yet functional. It's in your hands turning it into a butterfly (üêõ) => ü¶ã
  actions:
    - theme: brand
      text: Get Started
      link: /documentation/
    - theme: alt
      text: Changelog
      link: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/releases
features:
  - icon: üëç
    title: CSS framework agnostic
    details: No specific CSS framework/library dependency, but you can easily integrate one of them, as oruga is fully customisable in many ways.
  - icon: üí™
    title: Components with steroids
    details: Most components aren't just wrappers around native elements, but add new and custom functionality ahead.
  - icon: ü™∂
    title: Lightweight
    details: Oruga has no other internal dependencies (except for Vue.js), and you can import only the components you need.
---
```

TITLE: Basic Datetimepicker Implementation in HTML
DESCRIPTION: Shows the basic implementation of the Oruga Datetimepicker component. This component allows users to select both date and time through a dropdown/modal interface on desktop and uses native controls on mobile devices.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Datetimepicker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<o-datetimepicker></o-datetimepicker>

TITLE: Documenting Table Component Events in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This markdown table documents the events available for the Oruga UI Table component. It includes event names, associated properties with their types, and descriptions of when each event is triggered.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Table.md#2025-04-23_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
### Events

| Event name          | Properties                                                                                                                                                                               | Description                                        |
| ------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- |
| page-change         | **page** `number` - updated page                                                                                                                                                         | on pagination page change event                    |
| dblclick            | **row** `T` - row data<br/>**index** `number` - index of clicked row<br/>**event** `Event` - native click event                                                                          | on row double click event                          |
| mouseenter          | **row** `T` - row data<br/>**index** `number` - index of clicked row<br/>**event** `Event` - native mouseenter event                                                                     | on row mouseenter event                            |
| mouseleave          | **row** `T` - row data<br/>**index** `number` - index of clicked row<br/>**event** `Event` - native mouseleave event                                                                     | on row mouseleave event                            |
| contextmenu         | **row** `T` - row data<br/>**index** `number` - index of clicked row<br/>**event** `Event` - native contextmenu event                                                                    | on row right click event                           |
| cell-click          | **row** `T` - row data<br/>**column** `TableColumn` - column data<br/>**index** `number` - row index<br/>**colindex** `number` - column index<br/>**event** `Event` - native click event | on cell click event                                |
| update:currentPage  | **value** `number` - updated currentPage prop                                                                                                                                            | currentPage prop two-way binding                   |
| update:selected     | **value** `T` - updated select prop                                                                                                                                                      | select prop two-way binding                        |
| select              | **newRow** `T` - new select value<br/>**oldRow** `T` - old select value                                                                                                                  | on row select event                                |
| check               | **value** `T[]` - all checked rows<br/>**row** `T` - row data                                                                                                                            | on row checked event                               |
| check-all           | **value** `T[]` - all checked rows                                                                                                                                                       | on all rows checked event                          |
| update:checkedRows  | **value** `T[]` - updated checkedRows prop                                                                                                                                               | checkedRows prop two-way binding                   |
| sort                | **column** `TableColumn` - column data<br/>**direction** `string` - 'asc' or 'desc'<br/>**event** `Event` - native event                                                                 | on column sort change event                        |
| filters-change      | **filters** `object` - filter object                                                                                                                                                     | on filter change event                             |
| filters-event       | **filtersEvent** `string` - props filtersEvent value<br/>**filters** `object` - filter object<br/>**event** `Event` - native event                                                       | on native filter event based on props filtersEvent |
| update:detailedRows | **value** `T[]` - updated detailedRows prop                                                                                                                                              | detailedRows prop two-way binding                  |
| details-open        | **row** `T` - row data                                                                                                                                                                   | on details open event                              |
| details-close       | **row** `T` - row data                                                                                                                                                                   | on details close event                             |
| click               | **row** `T` - row data<br/>**index** `number` - index of clicked row<br/>**event** `Event` - native click event                                                                          | on row click event                                 |
| dragstart           | **row** `T` - row data<br/>**index** `number` - index of draged row<br/>**event** `DragEvent` - native dragstart event                                                                   | on row dragstart event                             |
| dragend             | **row** `T` - row data<br/>**index** `number` - index of draged row<br/>**event** `DragEvent` - native dragend event                                                                     | on row dragend event                               |
| drop                | **row** `T` - row data<br/>**index** `number` - index of draged row<br/>**event** `DragEvent` - native drop event                                                                        | on row drop event                                  |
| dragleave           | **row** `T` - row data<br/>**index** `number` - index of draged row<br/>**event** `DragEvent` - native dragleave event                                                                   | on row dragleave event                             |
| dragover            | **row** `T` - row data<br/>**index** `number` - index of draged row<br/>**event** `DragEvent` - native dragover event                                                                    | on row dragover event                              |
| columndragstart     | **column** `TableColumn` - column data<br/>**index** `number` - index of draged column<br/>**event** `DragEvent` - native columndragstart event                                          | on column columndragstart event                    |
| columndragend       | **column** `TableColumn` - column data<br/>**index** `number` - index of draged column<br/>**event** `DragEvent` - native columndragend event                                            | on column columndragend event                      |
| columndrop          | **column** `TableColumn` - column data<br/>**index** `number` - index of draged column<br/>**event** `DragEvent` - native columndrop event                                               | on column columndrop event                         |
| columndragleave     | **column** `TableColumn` - column data<br/>**index** `number` - index of draged column<br/>**event** `DragEvent` - native columndragleave event                                          | on column columndragleave event                    |
| columndragover      | **column** `TableColumn` - column data<br/>**index** `number` - index of draged column<br/>**event** `DragEvent` - native columndragover event                                           | on column columndragover event                     |

TITLE: Defining SCSS Variables and Maps for Oruga UI Bulma Theme
DESCRIPTION: This SCSS snippet defines variables and maps for the Bulma theme in Oruga UI. It includes size mappings, color definitions, and custom color merging. The code also sets up root and host variables, defines speed variables, and creates a merged custom colors map.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/themes/theme-bulma.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: scss
CODE:
```
// This file is home to defaulted variables which DO reference bulma but are not part of a particular component


$sizes-map: (
    "small": dv.$size-small,
    "normal": dv.$size-normal,
    "medium": dv.$size-medium,
    "large": dv.$size-large,
) !default;
// This file is home to defaulted variables which need to be passed to Bulma, or to general defaulted variables which are not part of a particular component


// adds :root variables also as :host
$enable-host: true !default;

$speed-slow: 150ms !default;
$speed-slower: 250ms !default;

// oruga defines an extra secondary color
$secondary: #6c757d !default;

// alternative to focus-shadow-size
$active-shadow-size: 0 0 0.5em !default;

$theme-bulma-custom-colors: () !default;

// Merge any user-defined custom colors with the custom colors defined by the theme. This will be passes to Bulma as $custom-colors
// This is the one variable in this file which is not defaulted, but it collects defaulted values so it counts. It's going to be passed into bulma so it has to be here so it comes first
// merge our custom-colors with the overridable map
$theme-bulma-custom-colors-merged: map.merge(
    (
        "secondary": $secondary,
    ),
    $theme-bulma-custom-colors
);
```

TITLE: Registering OrugaConfig Plugin with Individual Components
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to register the OrugaConfig plugin when using individual component plugins instead of the main Oruga plugin, which makes the config interface available through useOruga.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/composables.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { createApp } from 'vue';
import { Autocomplete, Sidebar, OrugaConfig, useOruga } from '@oruga-ui/oruga-next';

const myConfig = { ... };

createApp(...)
    // register individual components by using their dedicated vue plugin
    .use(Autocomplete)
    .use(Sidebar)
    // register the global oruga config plugin
    .use(OrugaConfig, myConfig);

const oruga = useOruga();

// now this is available
const config = oruga.config.getOptions();

config.setOption("autocomplete", {
    rootClass: 'autocomplete-root',
    itemClass: 'autocomplete-item',
    ...
});

config.setOption("sidebar", { ... });
```

TITLE: Transforming Applied Classes Using Transform Functions
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use transformClasses functions to modify applied class names. Shows both global transformation and component-scoped transformation that replace hyphens with double hyphens.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/customisation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
createApp(...)
    .use(Oruga, {
        // global transform function
        transformClasses: (appliedClasses: string) => {
            return appliedClasses.replace(/-/g, '--')
        }
        button: {
            // component scoped transform function
            transformClasses: (appliedClasses: string) => {
                return appliedClasses.replace(/-/g, '--')
            }
        }
        ...
    })
```

TITLE: Programmatic Interface Type Definition
DESCRIPTION: Defines the TypeScript type for programmatic component interfaces in Oruga. This interface provides methods to create, count, and close programmatic component instances.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/composables.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
type ProgrammaticInterface = {
    /** Returns the number of registered active instances. */
    count: () => number;
    /** 
     * Create a new programmatic component instance. 
     * The options argument depend on the component. 
     * The target specifies the element the component get rendered into - default is `document.body`.
     */
    open: (options: Record<string, any>, target?: MaybeRefOrGetter<string | HTMLElement | null>) => ProgrammaticExpose;
    /** 
     * Close the last registred instance in the programmatic instance registry.
     * Any arguments which get passed to the exposed `close()` function of the component.
     */
    close: (...args: unknown[]) => void;
    /** 
     * Close all instances in the programmatic instance registry.
     * Any arguments which get passed to the exposed `close()` function of the component.
     */
    closeAll: (...args: unknown[]) => void;
};

type ProgrammaticExpose = {
    /** Call the close event of the component. */
    close: (...args: unknown[]) => void;
    /** Promise which get resolved on the close event. */
    promise: Promise<unknown>;
};
```

TITLE: ComponentProgrammatic Open Function Type Definition
DESCRIPTION: Defines the TypeScript type for the open function of the ComponentProgrammatic interface, which allows rendering any component programmatically with options for target, props, and event handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/composables.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
type open = <C extends VNodeTypes>(
    /** component to render **/
    component: C, 
    /** render options */
    options?: ProgrammaticOptions<C>, 
) => ProgrammaticExpose;


type ProgrammaticOptions<C extends VNodeTypes> = {
    /** 
     * The target specifies the element the component get rendered into.
     * @default `document.body`.
     */
    target?: MaybeRefOrGetter<string | HTMLElement | null>; 
    /**
     * Specify the template `id` for the programmatic container element.
     * @default `programmatic-app`
     */
    appId?: string;
    /**
     * Props to be binded to the injected component. 
     * Both attributes and properties can be used in props.
     * Vue automatically picks the right way to assign it.
     * `class` and `style` have the same object / array value support like in templates.
     * Event listeners should be passed as onXxx.
     */
    props?: ComponentProps<C>,
    /**
     * On component close event.
     * This get called when the component emits `close` or the exposed `close` function get called.
     */
    onClose?: (...args: unknown[]) => void,
}
```

TITLE: Using ConfigProgrammatic for Direct Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to directly use the ConfigProgrammatic object without the useOruga composable to modify Oruga's configuration. This approach works the same as using the config within useOruga.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/documentation/composables.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { ConfigProgrammatic, type OrugaOptions } from '@oruga-ui/oruga-next';

// get the current config
const config = ConfigProgrammatic.getOptions();

// modify the config object
const myThemeConfig: OrugaOptions = {
    ...config,
    autocomplete: {
        rootClass: 'autocomplete-root',
        itemClass: 'autocomplete-item',
        ...
    }
}

// update the config
ConfigProgrammatic.setOptions(myThemeConfig);
```

TITLE: Accessing Default Configuration for icon in TagInput Component
DESCRIPTION: Shows the default configuration for the icon property which sets the icon to be shown in the tag input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Taginput.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
taginput: {
  icon: undefined
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Empty State Label in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Sets the label text to be shown when the table has no data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Table.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
table: {
  emptyLabel: undefined
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Overlay for Oruga UI Sidebar
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the default setting for the overlay property. It determines whether to show a modal-like overlay with the sidebar.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Sidebar.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
sidebar: {
  overlay: false
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuration for Input Component's Autocomplete Prop
DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the autocomplete property in Oruga UI's Input component, setting it to "off" by default.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Input.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
input: {
  autocomplete: "off"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Datepicker aria-select-month-label in Oruga UI
DESCRIPTION: Default configuration for the aria-select-month-label accessibility property in the Datepicker component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oruga-ui/oruga/blob/develop/packages/docs/components/Datepicker.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
datepicker: {
  ariaSelectMonthLabel: "Select Month"
}
```
